question: 出かける
sourceMnemonic:
You <kanji>exit</kanji> but you do it with <ja>かける</ja> added to it. Just think of that <ja>かける</ja> as you are exiting while being "cocky" about it. You do this when you want <vocabulary>to go out</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>to leave</vocabulary>. You go out in a cocky way!

This word can only be used for a person going out. You can't say a train <ja>出かける</ja>'d.
sourceReadingMnemonic: Since this word consists of a kanji with hiragana attached, you can bet that it will use the kun'yomi reading. You learned this reading when you learned <ja>出る</ja>, so if you can remember that, you should be able to remember this one too!
